intro: Lomatium klickitatense, commonly known as Klickitat lomatium, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. Its leaves are compound, with a distinctive lacy appearance and a strong, spicy scent. The flowers are small and white, appearing in early summer, followed by the development of brown, papery fruits.
